results.title: The Waterboy
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Robert Simonds, Jack Giarraputo and Frank Coraci
results.brief_description: In this comedic film of sight gags Adam Sandler plays the role of Bobby Boucher, a water boy for the local college football team. Bobby cops it from all directions - his over-bearing mother (Kathy Bates), the football team and even the coach (Jerry Reed). When the coach fires him, Bobby is forced to join the rival team under Coach Klein (Henry Winkler) where he turns his talents from water boy to a star tackler setting this losing team on the road to victory. Love, glory and revenge await Bobby as he takes up his new life as a football hero and college student. Cast includes Fairuza Balk, Blake Clark and Larry Gilliard Jr.

results.title: The Water waster
results.brief_description: A humorous look at the very serious problem of water wastage that poses the question “Can a water waster really be cured?” Steve Blackburn (of Tim and Debbie fame) plays the part of an irresponsible water user who needs to be taught a lesson or two.

results.title: The Water trolley (K)
results.creator_credit: Penny Spence, Nine Network and Noel Price
results.brief_description: When young Paul’s father is badly hurt in an explosion, his mother calls in the Flying Doctor Service and Paul is left to care for the farm. His immediate concern is to fetch water from a nearby property - a task that becomes fraught with difficulties. Based on a story by Colin Thiele.

results.title: The Water trolley
results.creator_credit: Penny Spence, Nine Network (Australia) and Noel Price
results.brief_description: When Paul’s father is badly hurt, the Royal Flying Doctor service has to be called. Paul is left in charge of the farm and must fetch water from a nearby property. This becomes a task fraught with problems. Based on the novel by Colin Thiele, this is an excellent production from the makers of the award winning children’s dramas, “Danny’s egg” and “Banduk”.

results.title: The Water planet
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Waterworks”.
‘Waterworks’ is an in depth series produced by the ABC on water and covers areas such as; human usage, molecular properties and the role of water in the ecology. ‘The Water planet’, first in the series, details broadly the concepts that govern the function of water and investigates the presence of water on earth and in space. The film starts with the premise that all life on earth is based on water and digresses to detail this relationship. The following subjects are covered from the presence of water in space, water cycles, water ecology, function of chemical parts in water, weather patterns and its relationship to water, water and plantlife, the oceans. Presented by series producer Dick Beilby.

results.title: The Water of life
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Big ice: views of Antarctica”.
The Antarctic continent is a unique natural laboratory for the study of simple life forms, and of physical and behavioural adaptations to inhospitable surroundings. The ocean surrounding Antarctica also has the world’s greatest untrapped food supply. The film asks whether controlled exploitation and development can take place without upsetting the delicate balance of nature.

results.title: The Water must go somewhere
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Graham Chase
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advance-warning techniques associated with flooding. Also shows methods of evacuation, and consequences of not following evacuation orders. Gives some criticism of the practice of building in areas where flooding is inevitable. Uses actual film footage shot during floods in Richmond, New South Wales.

results.title: The Water miners
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Guy Ballantyne
results.brief_description: An examination of the large hydro-electric power scheme envisaged for the Gordon River system in Tasmania. Shows exploration of the area, building of roads and camps, and the work of all the hydrologists and engineers. The plan is to build dams in the steep gorges to catch water to turn the turbines.

results.title: The Water famine
results.creator_credit: Jack Beck and Columbia Broadcasting System Television
results.brief_description: The role of water in the birth and decay of civilization and the problems of man as he searches for new sources. The critical water shortage and the population explosion; the problems of pollution; desalinization demonstrated by the “flash freezing” process used in Israel and the electro-dialysis process used in the United States.

results.title: The Water dwellers
results.creator_credit: John Hosking, Don Murray, Jim Jeffrey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
A study of the people living and working in the Pittwater area 25 miles north of Sydney, New South Wales.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
